title: Prostitute, 22, 'tried to extort $15,000 from a married man after recording their threesome
text:
A prostitute has been charged with attempting to extort a married Missouri man out of $15,000, and then posting a video recording of their threesome on Facebook when he refused to pay her the full amount.

Kailynn Havannah Alexandria Moore-Jones, 22, on Monday pleaded not guilty to a federal extortion charge in St Louis.

According to court documents obtained by DailyMail.com, a man from St Louis County met Moore-Jones through the escort website escortbabylon.net on August 6, and had sex with her and another woman at Pear Tree Inn St Louis Airport later the same day.

Sextortion: Prostitute Kailynn Havannah Alexandria Moore-Jones, 22 (left and right), has pleaded not guilty to a federal extortion charge in a revenge porn case

Three's company: Moore-Jones is accused of meeting a married man for sex with another woman in August, and secretly recording their encounter

The transnational tryst took place at Pear Tree Inn St Louis Airport on August 6

Moore-Jones allegedly made a surreptitious recording of the sexual encounter, and soon began calling, texting and sending Facebook messages to her client, identified in documents only by his initials, R.W., threatening to ruin his reputation by making the sex tape public, unless he paid her $15,000.

The man wired a total of $2,200 to Moore-Jones in three installments, according to the court documents, but the sex worker was apparently not content and continued demanding more money.

When the client did not deliver, Moore-Jones allegedly made good on her threat and posted their sex tape on Facebook pages belonging to the man, his wife and his employer, according to the charging papers.

In late August, the victim contacted the FBI and told federal agents about the prostitute’s alleged extortion and revenge porn scheme.

She then allegedly began threatening to post the sex tape on Facebook, unless her male client paid her $15,000 in hush money

The man ended up paying Moore-Jones only $2,200. After that, the woman allegedly shared the sex tape on Facebook pages belonging to him, his wife and his boss

The next day, agents listened in as the client called Moore-Jones and she agreed to take down the video if he paid her more money, according to the records.

The mom-of-one was arrested three days later, and she was indicted on the federal extortion charge on September 26, reported St Louis Post-Dispatch.

The affidavit states that Moore-Jones' criminal history includes charges of prostitution, theft and domestic violence.

Moore-Jones’ Facebook page is filled with photos of her young daughter and her boyfriend of three years.
description: Kailynn Havannah Alexandria Moore-Jones, 22 (left and right), has pleaded not guilty to a federal extortion charge in a revenge porn case involving her married client from Missouri.
